intro: Dodonaea rhombifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hop萧, is a shrub native to Australia. It features small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Dodonaea rhombifolia is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
